In Das Kapital, Marx explores the concepts of surplus value, labor theory of value, and class struggle, which are key foundations of Marxist economic theory. He delves into the exploitative nature of capitalism, highlighting the inherent contradictions and inequalities within the system. Das Kapital also addresses the relationship between labor and capital, examining how the capitalist mode of production perpetuates class divisions and alienation. These concepts and ideas put forth in Das Kapital have had a profound impact on shaping Marxist economic theory.
